com.percussion.loader
Interface IPSItemExtractor

All Superinterfaces:
IPSPlugin
All Known Implementing Classes:
PSExtractor, PSItemExtractor, PSStaticItemExtractor
public interface IPSItemExtractor
extends IPSPlugin

See base interface for a more generic description. Plugins implementing this interface fit into the migration/loader model as the analyzer of content. Each plugin is responsible for analyzing a resource and determining if it fits the pattern of the content type for which it was written. The analysis could be very simple or very complex.

The manager of the loading process gives each plugin an opportunity to 'view' the resource and make a determination if it contains 1 or more instances of the content type / variant of interest to this plugin. It is acceptable for multiple plugins to express interest in the same resource.

The plugin should extract all instances of interest in a single pass and return them as seperate items.

Method Summary

Methods inherited from interface com.percussion.loader.IPSPlugin
configure
 

Method Detail

containsInstances

int containsInstances(PSItemContext resource)
This method is called by the loader manager to 'guess' the content type of the supplied resource. This information may then be provided to a user for correction/amplification. Each plugin will have its own method for making this determination.

Parameters:
resource - The data to be analyzed, including its meta data. Never null.
Returns:
The number of items that would be created if the extractItems(PSItemContext, InputStream) method was called with the supplied resource.

extractItems

PSItemContext[] extractItems(PSItemContext resource,
                             InputStream in)
                             throws IOException
Performs an analysis of the supplied resource data and extracts all found instances appropriate for this plugin. Will return as many items as the count returned by containsInstances(com.percussion.loader.PSItemContext). If the supplied resource contains no instances, an empty array is returned. If any instances are found, the supplied resource will be the first item in the returned array.

The current implementation will only process the first item from the returned array. The rest of the items will not be processed.

Parameters:
resource - the data that contains the instances, never null .
in - The stream that can be used to get the source data. The caller of this method is responsible to close this stream, but not the method itself.
Returns:
an array of extracted items, may be empty, never null .
Throws:
IOException - if error occurs during retrieving the content.

getConfigure

Element getConfigure()
Get the configuration of the object. see IPSPlugin.configure(Element).

Returns:
The config of the object, never null.
